question: Can yoghurt cure a yeast infection?
question_content: Right, so this is grim but I'm supposed to be going to the doctors on Friday for something to help with my yeast infection but whilst I was waiting I bought some plain yoghurt containing live cultures as I heard it helps to soothe and relieve the itch. The itching was unbearable, so unbearable that I couldn't sleep, I was very sore and had small cuts from itching too much... I put the yoghurt on the outside and inside of my vagina and left it for 45 minutes, I then had a bath to wash it off and repeated the same thing the next day. My symptoms have now disappeared, I no longer have white clumpy discharge, I am not itchy in the slightest, not sore and my small cuts are healing, I am no longer red down there... Has my yeast infection gone or is it going? Or will the problem still be there? It feels normal down there again but I've read yoghurt doesn't help... Confused!!

answers.answer_content: Yes, it could cure a yeast infection
